ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Patch Message
ygData.msgSnippet: I don t see how this change does anything but make a worthless song worthless.  If I m trying to plug a 3-foot hole in a dam with 3 sticks of chewing gum,
ygData.messageBody:
I don't see how this change does anything but make a worthless song worthless. If I'm trying to plug a
3-foot hole in a dam with 3 sticks of chewing gum, handing me a fourth stick of gum doesn't help. I've
memmed this song a few times in an attempt to find some song combination that could let me aggro the
primary MOB; I have never once had it land for any damage. It is always resisted. Increasing zero by 25%
still gives you, well, zero. Even if this were utterly resist-proof (and as a once every 40 minutes
"desperate" song, I think it easily could be), it still does so little damage on a high-end MOB that you
won't see the hit bar move. Why would anyone waste a song slot on this?

I wouldn't care, except that Verant probably thinks they've done us a favor, and will count this towards
their belief that we're "balanced". And if this is they way they're going to balance all the REST of the
stuff, well....

Kenross Cantoforjado, 57 songs, Innoruuk



Jeffrey Sue wrote:

> At 11:20 AM 2/21/01 -0500, you wrote:
> >all I can say is (excuse my language) what a fucking joke. 10 points per
> >level above level 45? Well damn, I do an extra 100 hp of damage with DDD,
> >it's still a complete and utter waste of a spell slot. I'm really going to
> >spend all my mana on 400 points of damage.
> >
> >I'm so disappointed it hurts. Why bother trying to "balance" the classes if
> >you're going to fall so short.
> >
> >Draelon Stormsong
>
> Why bother trying to discuss class balance if you're not going to even look at the possibility
> that bards are overpowered already? And if you won't accept that if bards are currently overpowered
> compared to other classes as a whole that they won't get major improvements while some other
> classes will, then I predict you are about to be even more disappointed.
>
>
> Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@... with the subject submissions.
